content: Singaporean politician **Imram bin Mohamed** (born 22 June 1944) was formerly the Senior Manager of Flight Operations and Chief Flight Engineer in [Singapore Airlines](/wiki/Singapore_Airlines), having worked there for 42 years. He was also the former chairman of the [Association of Muslim Professionals](/wiki/Association_of_Muslim_Professionals), of which he was a founding member. He was a [Nominated Member of Parliament](/wiki/Nominated_Member_of_Parliament) in the 8th [Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) after which, he was given the public post of [Justice of the Peace](/wiki/Justice_of_the_Peace#Singapore) under the Prime Minister's Office in Singapore.[*citation needed*] He served in Singapore's [2011 Parliamentary Elections](/wiki/2011_Singaporean_general_election) Malay Community Committee, was the chair of the [2015 Parliamentary Elections](/wiki/2015_Singaporean_general_election) Malay Community Committee[*citation needed*], and is once again the chair of the [2017 Presidential Elections](/wiki/2017_Singaporean_presidential_election) Malay Community Sub-committee â€“ a five-member panel tasked with assessing whether prospective presidential candidates belong to the Malay community in Singapore. ## Family life Imram Mohamed is the second of seven siblings.[*citation needed*] He is married to Jamaliah Saharuddin and has four children.[*citation needed*] This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Imram bin Mohamed
